\'From date\' cannot be more than 180 days.
\'To date\' cannot be more than 180 days.

\'From date\' cannot be more than today\'s date.
\'To date\' cannot be lesser than \'From date\'.
\'From date\' cannot be lesser than \'to date\'.

string-array.item: Your account is locked. Please contact us on 0860111123.
Your credentials have expired. Please reset your credentials via Absa Online or call us on 0860111123.
Technical Difficulty. Please try again. If the problem persists call us on 0860111123. Error code 00004
Oops!\nIncorrect details entered.\nYour profile will be locked after 3 incorrect attempts.

resources.string: Your session has logged out please log in again.
The main user must logon to Absa online or the Banking App to authorise the device before you can bank using the app from Absa

The My Notice of Payment is \'on\'. Please ensure that you select an option that contains your pre-populated details. If none of the options contain your details, then you are currently not able to use this function. Please switch \'off\' the My Notice of Payment
Rooted device detected. Please note that the Absa App will not allow rooted devices in the next app update as the security of your data is important to us.
Image size is too big. It should be less than 50kb

If you change your Absa Online limits to zero you will not be able to increase your limits, pay beneficiaries or process interaccount transfers online. You will have to visit a branch to set your limits again.
If you change your Absa ATM or Point of Sale limit to zero, you will not be able to withdraw cash or pay at a point of sale until you have increased your limit.
Are you sure you want to delink this device?
Are you sure you want to remove this device?

Sorry. Absa Smartphone and Tablet banking via this app is not supported on rooted devices.\n\nWe don\'t allow rooted devices as the security of your data is important to us. If you would like to make use of this app on your device, you will need to restore the factory settings. If you need help, please call us on 0860 11 11 23
A maximum of 5 devices can be linked to your profile. In order to add another device, please select a device to delink.
Your device has been successfully delinked

Please enter a value that is greater than or less than your current limit.
Must contain both numbers and letters
Must not contain any special characters i.e. */?-&%#@!<>() or spacing
Must not contain a sequence e.g. 123

SurePhrase is your personalised welcome message. It will display each time you logon to digital banking. This validates that you are on the valid banking channel as it cannot be duplicated by fraudsters due to personal nature of the phrase.
You may only view account balances and transfer between accounts. You will not be able to make payments.\n\nPlease visit the nearest Absa branch to update your details and set your limits.

resources.string: Your ATM card is either blocked or expired.

Fantastic, \nYou are registered for online banking
The access account number you chose when you registered for the Absa Online service.
The PIN must be numeric and can be either four or five digits long.
If you have more than one person (user) accessing your accounts, the number identifies who the user is. The account holder is always user No. 1
Please enter the correct login details
Remember to enter the correct account number and pin.\nOn the third incorrect attempt, your online profile will be blocked.

I acknowledge that this is a gift payment.

• Western Union payments will be made under your Single Discretionary Allowance* of R1 million per year.\n\n• There is no need for documents, and the currency you buy is reported under the Reserve Bank reporting category of “401 – Gift”.
You have no saved Western Union beneficiaries.

Your beneficiary’s:

1. Permanent physical address
2. Full names as displayed in their ID/Passport
3. Current location

• Your beneficiary needs the MTCN and their ID/Passport to collect funds.

• Payments are through Western Union and can only be:

	1. To individuals and not corporations
	2. A max. of R30,000 per payment
	3. A max. of $8,000 per day

Send money to anyone in the world in 3 steps:

1. Create and pay a beneficiary
2. Receive an Money Transfer Control Number (MTCN)
3. Send this MTCN to your beneficiary to be able to redeem the funds from a Western Union agent in their current location.

This service is only available between:

Monday to Friday
08:00 - 16:30

Saturdays
08:00 - 12:00

Unavailable on Sundays and public holidays.
• I have read the %1s and understand the contents thereof;
• I have read the Regulatory and Compliance %1s and understand the contents thereof;

I/We confirm that none of parties/ parties to this transaction, the country of origin the country of destination pertaining to goods/services can be linked to any countries mentioned below. In the event that any of the countries mentioned below, I hereby confirm that the bank may prohibit the transaction, instruction or account I may be applying for. I confirm further that the bank may also i have to end its relationship without warning Iran, North Korea, Burma/Myanma, Syria, Sudan (North) and Cuba.

• The information furnished above is all respect true and correct

• The currency applied for will only be used for the specific purpose stated herein; The documentation presented in support of this application is in all respect authentic

• I have been inform of the limit applicable to the above transaction and confirm, that this limit will not be exceeded as a result of the conclusion of this transaction; and

• I consent to this information being provided to the South African Revenue service and/or the Financial Intelligence Center.

• I confirm that the supporting documentation will be retained for a period of 5 (five) years, for inspection purposes by the financial surveillance department of the South African Reserve Bank

• I fully understand, that should I NOT submit the related documentary evidence in support of my payment instruction, to the bank within the given time frames, the payment request will be cancelled.
Where is the money being sent to?
*If names are not stated exactly as in ID/Passport, collection can be refused.
There are no payments made for this Western Union beneficiary.

Your transaction has been successfully submitted under payment reference %1$s. The proof of payment can be viewed on Absa Online Banking.\n\nYou will receive the Western Union MTCN (Money Transfer Control Number) via SMS within the hour. Please share the MTCN with %2$s.
How much do you want to send?
You will not be able to make another Western Union payment, as your last payment is still processing. Please try again in 1 hour.

Do you want to continue?
An unexpected error has occurred. Please try again later.
You can now view, accept and reject new DebiCheck Debit Orders from the app. Tap on the profile image to action new debit orders.
DebiCheck authorisation is a debit order payment method of honoring your payment obligations with Absa/the creditor.
Your authorisation only affects the time of payment. If you don’t confirm, the debit order will not be part of the DebiCheck process but payment may still be processed.
If you decline a DebiCheck debit order mandate you may be in breach of your agreement with Absa/the creditor and it may affect your credit record.
You only need to confirm the debit order once unless you change certain details on your debit order with us or a third party and we may ask you to confirm those changes.

If you agree to a date adjustment, it means that collection can take place on any day other than the collection day. It is your responsibility to ensure that there are sufficient funds in your account or a penalty fee will be charged.
If you think that the debit order is fraudulent or the details are incorrect, contact us immediately on any of our channels.
Once a DebiCheck debit order is cancelled and the need arises to have it re-instated, this process must be initiated by the creditor.

Our products and services rely on technological infrastructure (e.g. ATM, point of sale terminals and computer systems). You understand and accept that service outages occur. During a service outage it may not be possible for you to use our products and services, and there may be delays in your transactions being processed and being reflected in your account statements.
If you reject a DebiCheck debit order and want to restore it later, you must contact the creditor.
The cut-off times for DebiCheck approvals may vary. Contact %s for more information.
I agree to the Terms of Use

Note that the transactions that were submitted as an immediate interbank payment will be processed after one hour. This payment can still be returned if there are insufficient funds at the time the payment is processed or if the transaction is cancelled before the payment.
1. Payment cut-off times are governed by Interbank clearing rules to which all SA banks adhere.

Note that the transactions that were submitted as an immediate interbank payment will be processed after one hour. This payment can still be returned by the system if there are insufficient funds at the time of the payment.

Please contact 08600 08600 (local) or
+27 11 335 4019 (international)

Swipe left to remove beneficiaries, change the amount paid or change the account paid from.

When an Immediate Interbank Payment (IIP) is used the transaction cannot be revoked, set aside or cancelled as the payment takes place immediately.An IIP will be more expensive than regular transactions which are subject to a time delay.\n\nThe fees for IIP transactions are available on the Absa website (www.absa.co.za) under “What are the charges?”.We can change the terms of IIP and delay access of the funds to beneficiaries if we deem it necessary to implement measures to combat fraud.We will give you notice in advance on our website of any such changes

Future dated payment scheduled successfully.This payment can still be returned if there are insufficient funds at the time the payments are processed or if the transactions are cancelled before the payment date.

DebiCheck authorisation is a debit order payment method of honoring your payment obligations with Absa/the creditor.

Your authorisation only affects the time of payment. If you don’t confirm, the debit order will not be part of the DebiCheck process but payment may still be processed.

If you decline a DebiCheck debit order mandate you may be in breach of your agreement with Absa/the creditor and it may affect your credit record.

You only need to confirm the debit order once unless you change certain details on your debit order with us or a third party and we may ask you to confirm those changes.

If you agree to a date adjustment, it means that collection can take place on any day other than the collection day. It is your responsibility to ensure that there are sufficient funds in your account or a penalty fee will be charged.

If you think that the debit order is fraudulent or the details are incorrect, contact us immediately on any of our channels.

Once a DebiCheck debit order is cancelled and the need arises to have it re-instated, this process must be initiated by the creditor.

Our products and services rely on technological infrastructure (e.g. ATM, point of sale terminals and computer systems). You understand and accept that service outages occur. During a service outage it may not be possible for you to use our products and services, and there may be delays in your transactions being processed and being reflected in your account statements.

If you reject a DebiCheck debit order and want to restore it later, you must contact the creditor.

The cut-off times for DebiCheck approvals may vary. Contact %s for more information.
